column1: Papers
column4: Are the impirical research objectives and the research questions defined in advance?
column5: Is the research protocol explicit? (data collection, population definition, analysis mechanisms ...)
column6: Are threats to validity conducted in a systematic way, and are countermeasures taken to reduce them?
column7: Is a pilot study presented in the research?
column8: Is the data presented or made available for further analysis?
column9: Does the research make evident the method of analysis applied in your data?
column10: Do the findings of the empirical study answer the research questions and / or hypotheses that have been raised?
column11: Is the case and its analysis units explicitly defined and presented? (size, domain, process and subjects)
column12: Does the researcher avoid any interference in the process, technique and methodology used in the case study?
column13: Is triangulation applied? (multiple methods of collection and analysis, multiple authors and various theories)
column14: Are ethical issues handled appropriately (personal intentions, integrity, confidentiality, consent and approval of the review board)?
column15: Does the study report provide implications for practice?
column16: Are the hypothesis (null hypothesis and alternative hypothesis) presented?
column17: Does any method was used to comprove/reject  the hyphotesis?
column18: Are the independent, dependent variables and their metrics presented?
column19: Were quantitative methods applied to interpret the results?
column22: Is it possible to identify the population, the intervention and the outcome in main research question?
column23: Are the reviews inclusion and exclusion criteria described?
column24: Is the search strategy defined in the study?
column25: Did the reviewers assess the quality/validity of the included studies
column26:
The study specifies and thoroughly describes its sampling method (e.g. nonprobabilistic
sampling methods, probabilistic sampling methods,etc.).
column27: The study describes how the questionnaire was designed (e.g. the number of questions, type and wording of the questions, question sequence and grouping, translations, etc.).
column28: The questionnaire of the study is available (e.g. attached to the report or included as an appendix, etc.).
column29: The study provides information on its response rate.
column30: The study formally assesses its trustworthiness (e.g. through calculating measurementerror, sample frame error, error of  selection, non-response error, etc.).
